step_1.description: The paper establishes that Parkin's Uld domain interacts with Rpn10, and structural instability in this domain is linked to AR-JP pathogenesis.

step_2.description: X-ray crystallography and MD simulations assess structural changes in wild-type vs. mutant Uld, aligning with the disease mechanism.

step_3a.description: Controls (wild-type Uld and mutants) are used, but replicates are not explicitly mentioned.

step_3b.description: No known pathogenic/benign variant controls are used; the study focuses on novel mutants.

step_3c.description: No variant controls (pathogenic/benign) are explicitly used in the assays.

step_4a.description: No statistical analysis or OddsPath values are reported.

step_4b.description: 0 pathogenic/benign variant controls used in the study.
